ud3.7:1: Thus I heard:At one time the Gracious One was dwelling near Rājagaha, in Bamboo Wood, at the Squirrels’ Feeding Place. Then at that time venerable Mahākassapa was dwelling in the Pepper Cave, and was sitting in one cross-legged posture for seven days, having attained a certain concentration.
ud3.7:2: Then at that time five hundred devatās were ready and eager to offer almsfood to venerable Mahākassapa. But venerable Mahākassapa, after refusing those five hundred devatās, having dressed in the morning time, after picking up his bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
ud3.7:3: Then at that time the lord of the devas Sakka, having a desire to give almsfood to venerable Mahākassapa, having created the appearance of a weaverfor himself, was weaving thread while the Asura maiden Sujā was filling the shuttle. Then venerable Mahākassapa, while walking systematically for alms in Rājagaha, went to the residence of the lord of the devas Sakka.
ud3.7:4: Then the lord of the devas Sakka after worshipping and circumambulating venerable Mahākassapa, after going up into the sky, while in the air, in the firmament, three times uttered an exalted utterance:
ud3.7:11: "Ah giving! The best gift is well established on Kassapa, Ah giving! The best gift is well established on Kassapa."
ud3.7:5: Then the Gracious One, having understood the significance of it, on that occasion uttered this exalted utterance:
ud3.7:6: "The devas envy the alms-gathering monk,Self-supporting, not nourishing another,Such a one, a peaceful one, one who is always mindful."
